AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.undocumented alien: individual being smuggled, involved in a case of reckless endangerment and resulting death during smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.nine undocumented aliens: group of nine undocumented immigrants being smuggled from Mexico to the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.seven other undocumented aliens: additional group of seven undocumented immigrants being smuggled from Mexico to the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.nineteen undocumented aliens: individuals being smuggled, involved in a case of reckless endangerment and resulting death during smuggling, transported through South Texas with inadequate water and food
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.two undocumented aliens: adult males found severely dehydrated and showing acute signs of heat stroke near the emergency call box
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez: person who died during the smuggling operation due to heat stroke caused by the harsh conditions of the South Texas desert trek, described as a 142-pound, normally developed and adequately nourished adult female in the autopsy report
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jaime Gomez-Arroyo: individual met by Border Patrol agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero: alien smuggler guide responsible for creating substantial risk of death or serious bodily injury to the undocumented aliens during the smuggling journey through South Texas, found to have recklessly contributed to the death of Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez, defendant in the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the smuggling incident occurred, imposing sentencing enhancements for alien smuggling offenses
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.South Texas Trek: location of the smuggling journey guided by Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, characterized by harsh desert conditions in June that contributed to the death of Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez, route taken by the smuggled individuals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IIRIRA: Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996, related to alien smuggling offense sentencing
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.House Conference Report No. 104-863: a report related to alien smuggling offense sentencing, detailing the imposition of sentencing enhancements for creating substantial risk of death or serious bodily injury
